content:
in this July   file photo Graham Spanier former president of Penn State leaves the court house in Harrisburg after the second day of the preliminary hearing PERIOD

Former Penn State President Graham Spanier filed a defamation lawsuit against Louis Freeh in Centre County court Wednesday PERIOD

Former FBI Director Freeh alleged Spanier along with other Penn State administrators covered up former assistant football coach Jerry Sanduskys child sex abuse in a  report PERIOD

Spanier filed two motions  one to lift the stay that was issued on the case in February  and another to expand the number of defendants according to court documents PERIOD

The second motion adds The Freeh Group and Penn State to defendants Freeh and his law firm Freeh Sporkin and Sullivan in order to avoid multiplicity of suits regarding the same transactions according to documents PERIOD

Spanier originally filed the suit in July of  PERIOD In October of that year the stay was issued pending resolution of the ongoing criminal case against Spanier as well as former Athletics Director Tim Curley and former Interim Vice President for Business and Finance Gary Schultz PERIOD
